comment.body: @Quantumworld:  Were you looking for https://necunos.com ? It looks somehow good, but hard to grasp. The Librem5 is much farther developed as it looks.  I also just found out that Pine want to develop a phone: https://liliputing.com/2018/10/pine64-is-developing-a-linux-smartphone.html

@caryoscelus: Ubuntu Touch is now community maintained at https://ubports.com
Ubports is one of the options that will run on the Librem5. The others bein gnome and KDE. I'm curious to see gnome and KDE phone implementations. Back in the OpenMoko days, they were far from where ubports is now. So ubports might well be the best option on the Librem5.
I always thought that was Vodka
What is the problem if you download that way?

@SadLoli: In what format would that be? 
All the random non-monetary stuff I saw so far was in text form, maybe even ascii art. If you would want to insert pictures or videos, you would also have to write a program to interpret the data, that is scattered over tons of transactions and blocks as whatever it was. In the same way, you could probably write a program to interpret the constitution as CP.
Or as a co-worker of mine always says: "With enough physical exercise you can eat whatever you want".
Try that with your wive, and report back what happened
You can be so charming
Is this the thing that is in the media, where Elon Musk bought one million trees?
Cool. We made some smaller ones last year with our kids. The kids then gifted them to the grand parents.
97% of people who spend their time on the topic: https://qz.com/1069298/the-3-of-scientific-papers-that-deny-climate-change-are-all-flawed/

I am wary of this issue as well. Thankfully I didn't click on something I didn't want to see so far, and I hope it stays that way. I don't want that shit on my harddrive even when it is encrypted.
I am still not sure how to educate and prepare my kids for the dangers of the free webs, without restricting them to only use curated platforms.
I read a book. The title had something like "type and the speed of thought". But most important: use it a lot. There are vim plugins for many IDEs
I assume, that runs neither on ubports nor on pureos?
I registered mine myself. Running a namecoin node is much lighter then a bitcoin node. There is also a electrum client for namecoin.
it is the past, present and future. But only for the people who care.

So you are reimplementing ZeroNet in Rust? Is the code public? I am currently reading a book about Rust. But I am still lacking practical experience.
@Ansho Rei: Cool, I will have a look at the source.

The book "Programming Rust" from O'Reilly has a chapter on macros. Just today I reached that chapter while reading through. Coming from C++ I don't really like macros. But the author ensures that Rust macros are better than what C++ inherited from C.
@Ansho Rei: Do you know [The Little Book of Rust Macros ](https://danielkeep.github.io/tlborm/book/)? I didn't check it out myself yet. But it was mentioned in the book I'm currently reading.
OMG, but then somebody unmasked it as fake news
